chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture Methamphetamine - Presence of Child Less Than 14 Years Old

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert C Whirry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Methamphetamine(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture Methamphetamine - Presence of Child Less Than 14 Years Old, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence is to commence immediately.  Sentences are to be concurrent to each other.  Court grants sentence credit of 318 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-No Contact with the co-defendant.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

records.addlTxt:
9:03 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty J. Steven Heil.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Heil has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions. 

Sentencing statement by DA Christenson.  Sentencing statement by Atty Heil.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 1

-3 years of Initial Confinement and 5 years of Extended Supervision

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.  Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-No Contact with the co-defendant.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

Count 2

3 years of Initial Confinement and 5 years of Extended Supervision.  

Sentences are to be concurrent to each other.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.  Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-No Contact with the co-defendant.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

Court finds the defendant eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Programs.

Court is not imposing the court appointed attorney fees and states reasons.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit from the time defendant was arrested.

Sentence is to commence immediately.

Court adjourned at 9:17 a.m.
Settlement Form (PTC)
Sentencing hearing on April 17, 2017 at 09:00 am.

11:13 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty J. Steven Heil.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement, will plea to counts 1 & 2 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in and defendant is free to argue.  State concurs.  Atty Heil concurs - defendant will be requesting a PSI.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 2 as charged nand orders counts 3-10 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a presentence investigation be conducted and filed with the court in 60 days.  Court sets for Sentencing on April 17, 2017 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:21 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 31, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 13, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 10, 2017 at 10:30 am.

1:37 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney J. Steven Heil present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Heil - have exchanged Discovery, believes that this matter will settle.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on January 10, 2017 at 10:30 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 1:38 p.m.
Status hearing on November 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Atty J. Steven Heil
State's
Status hearing on November 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Heil and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Heil enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for State Hearing on Novmeber 22, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:43 p.m.
Arraignment on October 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

2:27 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty J. Steven Heil.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Heil - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State requests to have time to file the information.  Court will set for Arraignment on October 18, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:30 p.m.
Atty J. Steven Heil
Waiver of Prelim on September 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Court sets for waiver of preliminary hearing on September 6, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 10:15 a.m.
Status hearing on August 16, 2016 at 10:00 am.

11:10 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  No appearance by Atty J. Steven Heil.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court adjourns to August 16, 2016 at 10:00 a.m. for Status Hearing.

Court adjourned at 11:11 a.m.
Inmate Release to the Court
